instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>:  No post, sleep light flashes 5 times, no video
threads.message:
Greetings.  I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a spinning fan, no video, no chime/post.  

There are 5 pads between <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> that are very slightly red, other than that I can find no evidence of any water damage.  I checked a few voltages related to the CPU in case that was the issue and found;

<SIGNAL>PPCPUVTT_S0_REG</SIGNAL> at 1.074v
<SIGNAL>SPI_ROM</SIGNAL> on pin 8 has 3.315
<SIGNAL>PVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL> = 1.103v

Any idea on where to look next?  Researching the 5 flashes of the sleep light I found there could be a ROM issue, which seems to all relate to this area of the board.  Any thoughts on where to go next or what to test?

thanks,
Paul

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>:  No post, sleep light flashes 5 times, no video
threads.message: Does a USB mouse light up? Tried known good PC8500 RAM? It could be the ROM, swap it from a donor.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>:  No post, sleep light flashes 5 times, no video
threads.message:
USB mouse flashed briefly
Tried a couple of good PC8500 RAM modules - still no boot.
Replaced SPIROM - MB is now fully functional!!!!

Help was much appreciated.
